page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY OF AYLESBURY
page.content: An archaeological excavation is currently being carried out in Prebendal Court,Aylesbury.They have found a defensive ditch from the Iron Age and Aylesbury is therefore sited inside a large previously unknown hillfort.Storage pits have been found and the existence of this hillfort provides the Bury part of Aylesbury. Another boundary ditch from Saxon times has also been found and the people who dug the ditch probably knew of "Aegil" the Saxon whose name forms the first part of Aylesbury. The first church in Aylesbury probably comes from Saxon times and lies beneath St.Mary's. The evidence of Medieval times is shown in the wells and cess pits which have been excavated.In later periods houses were built along this site which destroyed earlier levels.
